abstract: Miner Rio Tinto said it remains committed to a planned $19.5 billion tie-up with Chinese metals firm Chinalco, responding to talk that the deal may be revised to let more shareholders take part in a rights issue.
snippet: Miner Rio Tinto said it remains committed to a planned $19.5 billion tie-up with Chinese metals firm Chinalco, responding to talk that the deal may be revised to let more shareholders take part in a rights issue.
lead_paragraph: Miner Rio Tinto said it remains committed to a planned $19.5 billion tie-up with the Chinese metals company Chinalco, responding to talk that the deal may be revised to let more shareholders take part in a rights issue.

headline.main: Rio Says It’s Committed to Chinalco Deal
